subject: Travel
title: Robert Peary and the North Pole Controversy
description: One-minute skill: Robert Peary and the North Pole Controversy.

hook.text: In 1909, Robert Peary claimed he reached the North Pole. The world celebrated.

buildup.text: He had spent 23 years and eight expeditions trying. He lost eight toes to frostbite along the way.

discovery.text: His rival Frederick Cook claimed he reached the pole a year earlier. Both men accused the other.

twist.text: Modern analysis suggests neither actually reached the exact pole. Both may have been miles off.

climax.text: The first verified surface trip to the North Pole wasn't until 1968, by snowmobile.

punchline.text: Two men fought over a record neither may have earned.

quiz.question: What did modern analysis suggest about Peary's claim?
options: He may have missed the exact pole
He never went to the Arctic
